All I have to do is get my film devoloped get one of this nifty Kodak CDs and I'll have everything. Posibly even the famous Winnie and Jibraun picture. . .
urlLink urlLink Here's the daily The Boondock's strip. This could be the beginning of another funny week.
urlLink urlLink Call me crazy, but has Catwoman ever looked like this before? Is Halle Berry trying to bring a new meaning to Catwoman?(Pun not intended.)
urlLink urlLink The two best characters in the new Shrek movie. While Puss in Boots is a great new character, you can't mess with donkey.
I just remembered that I have a free period tomorrow because I don't have to take the Driver's Ed final. So I get a full hour and a half of extra study time for my Geometry final!
No hatin' on my blog! Just because I don't have xanga does not mean you can hate on my xanga-like page.

Good job Lakers in getting yourself beat by 18. Keep it up and you won't even get to have a chance at winning the championship. Heck, the Timberwolves are pretty cool and Kevin Garnett deserves it, so keep up the good work.

Coming live from Mr. Alba's first period Driver's Ed. class it is me again. I have free time to study for finals tomorrow. It's always a lot of fun to have free time in Driver's Ed. Knock out a forgotten homework assingment for school or something else. Sometimes I get to chill and cruze the internet.
Due to low ratings and my sudden lack of interest there will not be any Weekly Hater Day. It sounded fun but it was actually pretty boring after awhile.
Here's another of my favorite sites. urlLink Homestarrunner.com is full of awesome things but in paticular the urlLink Strong Bad Emalis are the best! Check it out! urlLink urlLink

urlLink urlLink What the heck is up with LA basketball teams? The Clippers can never keep a player because they always trade and mess up the team. For example, I thought Darius Miles was pretty good and he helped the team a lot, but no they just had to trade him. As for the Lakers, I don't know what it is but something about I dislike. The only reason they deserve a championship this year is because of Payton and Malone.
It is kind of weired how I am doing all of these blogs and probably no one has even seen it it. Not that it really matters but it is kind of defeats the purpose of it all.
urlLink urlLink Why in the world did they get rid of the Angry Beavers?! It was the best show ever and they got rid of it!

Warning Reader! Never try and get a running start to touch the ceiling of your garage, because you may end up slipping on a random article of clothing and slamming into your dryer causing there to be a large dent in it. You know, just a suggestion. . .

urlLink urlLink Tomorrow will be the first annual Hater Day! From now on I going to get all my hating out on Sunday to spare my friends during the weedays at school. I know Sunday sounds like a bad day, but hey the Bible says you can't work on Sunday and says nothing about hatin'. Besides hatin' now a days isn't much work anyway. . .

Of course it can't be all work and no play, so that is why I visit urlLink miniclip.com frequently. It is definetely the best game site I know of. It has every thing you want to play and more. Plus it is all free! urlLink urlLink

urlLink Two exams a day for three days, it is going to be a slow week! Luckily the very first exam I won't have to take because I am to young to take drivers ed. Other then that, it's time to study for Geometry, English, Religion, History and Spanish ! urlLink
It took me awhile, but now I have this picture thing down. Now I can really have some fun!
urlLink The best comic strip in the world! urlLink
Finally my own website space! Hopefully I'll make this a habit and visit frequently, especially if I can get some pictures...

New Orleans is a lot cooler then I thought it would be. There is a lot of cool things to do here and you get use to the 85 degree plus weather (plus a crap load of humidity)pretty fast. The food is awesome and the only thing I can complain about is the streets that smell like vomit every ten steps you walk. This time I will have pictures because I bought a couple of disposable cameras. Now it's off to the zoo. . .
What ever happened to our track banquet? Did I miss it or something? Help someone . . .

I'm back again, I have been to bored to update. I'm leaving for New Orleans in 3 days and I won't be back for 5 weeks. I'm not sure if I will be able to update. At least i finally get to do something. When I return I will only be here for like two days then I'm leaving for Montreal (it is in Canada) for two weeks. Then school starts soon . . . At least I will know some French!

Yesterday, much to my dislike I had a couple of suprises when I gotto my pictures. Suprise #1, you can't get a CD with 110 film so I can't get it on the computer. Suprise #2, I turned in two rolls of film guess how many pictures I got? Five! One roll was blank which was the good roll and the other only had the five! I was really mad.

I am finally going to pick up my pictures today! I disappointed that I didn't get pictures of the seniors handy work especially the lunch table pyramid. Well I guess I still have some other good pictures. . .

I've kind of stopped posting since the summer began, but now I am back, and school is actually over. Things were getting pretty dull like the end of the track season, but now it is over and I can enjoy my time off. At least the last day of school was pretty interesting when everyone showed up to find the long hall (which holds like two thirds of the classrooms) trashed by the seniors. Sucks for them because they got grad night cancelled.

Yesterday when I arrived at the airport after my five hour flight I discovered that my bag had gone missing. I ended up having to go through this whole process so they would look for my bag. Any way I had to go shopping for another outfit because I didn`t know when my bag would be found. The malls here in Montreal are huge. It`s basically five stories of clothes, tech, and shoe stores. Plus there was more then one connected to each other. The good news is they found my bag and it should be delivered. I`ll try and get some pictures of Montreal. By the way, French is way harder then I thought but almost everyone speaks English too.
Just to let everyone know I was voted the coolest thirteen year-old two consecutive times. At least my age is good for something.

It seems my blog is still being ignored by everyone, but whatever. . . I`m in Montreal right now and I feel like an idiot because I don`t know any French. It`s basically impossible to understand the person who runs my homestay unless she speaks in English first. Other then that the other two guys here are cool. All I have to do is find my way to class tomorrow using the Metro. Until then. . .

My time here at Stanford is coming to a close, but this Journalism camp was actually pretty fun. The only problem I had was my watche's alarm isn't very loud so this morning I woke up at 7:45 and we're supposed to be at class at 8:00. Luckily I had taken a shower the night before and class didn't start until 8:15. Anyway,my summer is finally starting to end, but at least I get to go to Canada first.

It seems I have been forgotten by everybody, but whatever. I'm at Stanford right now and in the middle of a rather hard journalism camp. The Governator is supposed to be here tomorrow, and I am trying to find a way to see his speech. Other then that nothing new. Also an ASB update would be nice.

I'm having problems with this but hopefully this works. . . Anyway I am still on vacation and I will be returning home for a short while in a short while. Right now I am in Monterey but I will be heading up to Stanford soon. I've noticed mostly been ignored lately but if anything interesting has happened feel free to comment.

I'm back in California, but I won't be returning home for another two and a half weeks. I will only be there two days because I leave for Montreal right after. I just got back from Berkely and it was pretty interesting, but mostly just crowed. The track camp was kind of fun, but I pulled my groin so I couldn't do anything most of the time. At least I have some cool stories for when I get back like how some of the other resident campers tried to stuff me down the linen shoot from eight stories up.

The story of My Epic Summer will be delayed until further notice. I'm having some serious problems right now (Here's a hint, not to sure about SCHS but somewhere out where my dad lives . . .). I'll post further on this crisis later.
Watch I'll prove no one vists my blog by asking a very important question and not get an answer! WHEN IS THE NEXT ASB MEETING AND WHAT TIME!!!
Because I have nothing else to do I now spend the time to bring you my blogs in multiple colors . Enjoy !

Note to New Readers(If I have any at all): Due to the fact that I know no one looks at my blog I don't edit or check for grammar mistakes. Some things may not make sense but it is okay because no one sees it anyway. It's like thinking only it is on the internet. P.S. If anyone does look spend the extra two seconds and a comment. There's like a million things to choose from.

It all started in New Orleans, Louisiana ! First off, you would not believe how humid it is there. That plus the heat could suffocate most people. Anyway, New Orleans was an awesome city. The only I didn't like was trash day because it made the city stink horribly. The zoo was the best one I have ever been to. It actually had interesting things to see unlike some other zoos (the Santa Barbara Zoo for example). My favorite day included three very important things: going to the zoo, seeing Harry Potter on an Imax screen and seeing the Mississippi River for the first time. Holy crap it's huge! No matter what you read the Mississippi looks bigger when you see it in real life. I was shocked because just the part within my eye sight was bigger then most lakes I have seen(I'm working on getting a picture). It was annoying that so many people acted like it was Mardi Gras every day there. Typical dumb American Tourist . Tomorrow, Part II describes my adventures at USM and what happens when everyone on your hall breaks camp rules at 12:00 pm on the last night.
Like I promised I'll be blogging about my summer. I have pictures, if I post them is questionable but maybe. I'm sure everyone will to learn about waht I did.
urlLink urlLink This comic strip is one of my favorites. Plus it also annoys my conservative friends.

News Flash! While the actual man himself has died the spirit of Rick James will live on forever in a very annoying joke. (Note: I thought about putting in a joke about St. Peter asking Rick James his name at the gates of Heaven, but I decided against it.)
I finally have an e-mail account so feel free to send stuff to smartguychester@yahoo.com. I'll find anyone who sends me spam or viruses.

I am now back in Oxnard and all of my summer camps are over. If I feel up to it I might post blogs on different camps. I might have pictures but They may be ruined. Anyway I'm sure everyone wants to here about all the cool things that happened in Montreal while I was there. Coming soon the edited story of my summer (the unedited version coming to a Santa Clara College Preparatory High School near you).
